title: Housni Benslimane
text:
<a href="General">General</a> Housni Benslimane (; born 14 December 1935, <a href="El%20Jadida">El Jadida</a>) is a senior <a href="Royal%20Moroccan%20Gendarmerie">Moroccan Gendarmerie</a> officer who has served since 1972 as the Commander-in-Chief of this unit. He also presides over the <a href="Moroccan%20Olympic%20Committee">Moroccan Olympic Committee</a> and was president of the <a href="Royal%20Moroccan%20Football%20Federation">Moroccan FA</a> between 1994 and 2009.
Housni Benslimane played <a href="Association%20football">football</a> for Moroccan club <a href="FAR%20Rabat">FAR Rabat</a> serving as <a href="Goalkeeper%20%28association%20football%29">goalkeeper</a> between 1958 and 1961.
Family.
Housni Benslimane is the son of "Abdelkrim Benslimane" the cousin of "El Fatmi BenSlimane", the Pacha of <a href="Fes">Fes</a> during the <a href="French%20protectorate%20in%20Morocco">French protectorate era</a>. He is also the nephew of <a href="Abdelkrim%20al-Khatib">Abdelkrim al-Khatib</a>, uncle of <a href="Ismail%20Alaoui">Ismail Alaoui</a>, the former president of the <a href="Party%20of%20Progress%20and%20Socialism">Party of Progress and Socialism</a> and cousin of <a href="Saad%20Hassar">Saad Hassar</a>.
One of his cousins (Mohamed Benslimane grandson of Fatmi Benslimane by his son Toufik and Lalla Badra, the daughter of "Moulay Hassan", a friend of Mohammed V who married an <a href="Alaouite%20dynasty">alaouite</a> princess) is married to <a href="Princess%20Lalla%20Zineb">Princess Lalla Zineb</a>, the sister of <a href="Prince%20Moulay%20Hicham%20of%20Morocco">Prince Moulay Hicham of Morocco</a>.
